text: This place is great . Good price , and I personally think this is better than wingstop . they give more for your money and much more flavorful .

This is my second time here and I was satisfied every time! The first I had the Garlic Parmesan Wings and the second time I got the mild flavor Bayou Bites. Each time the food was bomb.com! The chicken was the perfect texture (not too dry and not too soggy) with really good flavor (not too salty). The staff is great and they stay on top of the cleanliness of place!
Good wings!  Nice and crispy, served fresh and hot. Many sauces to choose from, so have fun and enjoy!!!
Fast and good!  Rivals the other major wing restaurants. Good prices too. I'll definitely go back.

This place was just a below average experience. Over priced to say the least. Ordered the boneless wing bits and it was like itty bitty chinese chicken bits. For the money head of the street to angelinas and get the chicken strips.

Just got back from dinner here...It was VERY good!
  After reading the mixed reviews, I was a little apprehensive about trying this place, but I REALLY had a craving for wings, so I went. I ordered mild, and sweet heat. Neither was spicy, but that's how I like my wings. The coating / crust on the wings was a little heavier than most places, but I enjoyed the texture. It was satisfying.
  As far as the mixed reviews of the customer service, all I can say is that we got the friendliest, and most attentive service I have had in a long time.  I asked for a few special requests (all flats & well done on some of the wings). They got it right, and were happy to do so. 
  We will be returning here for more wings in the future!
The flavors were pretty good but there was so much grease dripping off the wings that I couldn't even finish them. I'd say just stick with Buffalo Wild Wings or Wingstop.

Thank you VooDoo! We needed them in our hood :-) okay, we got the take-out 24 (something I cant remember) where you get a side (fries were really good!) And 3 flavors of wings that were all SO juicy. We had the garlic parmesean of yumminess, the teriyaki sticky sweet goodness, and the VooDoo little bit of heat with great flavorness! They throw in celery and ranch, plus the hubbs just had to try the fried pickles which he said were awesome-sauce,  pickles had good crunch, good breading & flavor.  5's fo sho & we'll be back often & soon! Enjoy LV! (Place was packed during dinner!)

I have been going to this  wing joint since it opened as Guthrie's and I've never met a more friendly, attentive, kind, and caring individual working there as the young lady who waited on me several times both in the drive thru and lobby I think she name is Shelby?
Anyway, she was so nice to me and my daughter she even gave my daughter this little toy (they don't do kids meals) but this girl went out of her way, when into her bag and pulled out a toy and gave it to my baby! I was shocked, I will definitely continue coming as long as Shelby is there, did mention she ALWAYS CALLED me by name? What a peach
These are the best wings in Vegas so it seems like. The staff is so nice. The only thing that sucks is that there wings are so high priced

It doesn't matter how good your food is or how nice the staff is!!  If you do NOT get the order right! It shows no pride, no respect for your customers and or yourself!! .  NOTHING erks my nerves more then ordering food; go through the drive thru.. get ALL the way HOME  and your order is missing something! !!!  My money is not missed when you take it for my purchase! !!

This place replaced Guthrie's on Cheyenne and Rainbow and I'm ecstatic. I have only gone through the drive thru, and while it might take a few minutes longer than I'd like, the food isalways worth the wait. The fried pickles are just ridiculously good, so crunchy on the outside. I really like the wings as well and while they may not have as many flavored of wing sauce as other places, the wings are cooked perfectly and the flavors are tasty. Two thumbs up.

I ordered lemon pepper 6 wings 4.99  added a drink and a side to equal 7.98

Cole slaw was particularly squishy with lots of liquid and the cabbage was soft also.  Flavor was weird.   So I pulled back around and mentioned that I wanted to get the potato salad to see if it was any better. She charged me 2.04. The potato salad was like nothing I have ever tasted. .and I don't mean that in a good way. 
If you eat here the wings taste great  but I recommend taking them home and add your own sides.

I would just like to add the last I visited I purchased the garlic parmesan  wings and they were delicious. The grease was fresh and they weren't all dark loved. I also have to say thanks to the management I'm sure if they read my review but the celery was not in the same container as the wings, I so thank them for it.

I came in and had the Voodoo flavored wings and I thought they were great. The price is reasonable for the high-quality wings you get. I took 24 of the Teriyaki and Voodoo back to my shop for the guys, and they ripped them to shreds. I guess they liked them too. ;-)

Voodoo is the new wing joint that took over the space that was Guthries. The building has been through a few different restaurants in the past few years but I'm hoping voodoo will manage to stick.

The menu is pretty simple they have maybe 10 different flavors of wings all of them wet style.  I think the simplicity is a good thing though, some places try to impress you with huge numbers of flavors and half of them are worthless or taste the same.  Voodoo keeps it simple all their flavors are distinct and more importantly taste great.  

I recommend the Voodoo house flavor it's a mix of soy and sriracha sauce but the bbq and hot are also good.  They have some good sides too, I'm not much for fried pickles but my friends can't get enough of them.

I do wish the place was a little bigger but other than that it's a great place to grab some wings if you're in the area.

We spotted the store from the road and took a chance.  It's nothing fancy, it seems to be Louisiana based as far as the food available. It is what it says it is: chicken wings. 

You can buy in various counts, the larger orders can be in 2 to 3 flavors.  I bought a 12 piece and chose mild and lemon pepper.  The wings were delightfully crispy without being greasy and full of flavor. My son chose the bites and was equally pleased. It does take a little longer to get the food as your food appears to be prepared fresh. The wings are not breaded. They have some  unusual sides such as fried pickles. 

Overall, we'll be going back.

I go here 5 times a week.... I know I have an addiction. I absolutely LOVE it here. The staff always takes care of me, no matter how busy. They give generous portions of food, with each order. My top favorite sauces for the wings, 1. BOMB, (be careful, the bomb is VERY spicy, and it's not meant for the weak taste buds) 2. MANGO JABANERO. 
Their french fries are my favorite. Always made just the way I like it. I'm addicted to this place, I'll drive any distance to get there. 

I've recommended a lot of my friends to go here, they have ALL loved it. We all used to go to Buffalo Wild Wings, but this place has much better wings, & way better pricing. 
The experience is great, each time. It's a tiny place, but there's a reason why everybody continues to go there. 

If you've been considering giving this place a shot, you know I'm going to say, absolutely. Give this place a shot, & I'm sure you won't regret it. :)

So, my boyfriend went here the other day after watching Hot Ones (the youtube series) and got the Bomb wings. Needless to say, they were crazy hot and he couldn't really eat them.Today, a few days later, I wanted to try their other flavors of wings after watching ANOTHER episode of Hot Ones. That show makes you want wings in the worst way. Haha.

I ordered a 12 piece, half Voodoo and half Mango Habanero for him; I went with the 9 piece, half hot and half lemon pepper -- well done! And I just HAD to try these fried pickles everyone keeps raving about with a Dr. Pepper. 

I am obsessed with the lemon pepper wings, they were cooked exactly how I like them with great flavor. The hot wings are super good too, especially with the ranch. I didn't try my boyfriend's wings but he seemed super pleased with them as well. The fried pickles deserve a paragraph for themselves but I'll just say they were AMAZING and I would come back just for those. 

The last thing I want to say is, you guys were not kidding about the soda machine. It is the absolute worst damn soda (if you want to call it that) I have ever had. It was just carbonated water with a splash of odd tasting syrup. I threw it away. 
Besides the soda, it was a super awesome experience with more than enough redeeming qualities to make me forget all about that teensy detail. As I sit here shoveling wings and fried pickles in my face, I am telling you that you need to give this place a try. Oh! And I received excellent service from an adorable girl at the window. Thank you for that as well, we'll be back!

Wanted wings and wingstop was too far of a drive. Gave this place a try and it wasn't a letdown at all. Got "24" wings for 20-something dollars. I only say 24 wings because they were generous with the count. Got 3 sauces: medium, garlic parmesan, and mango habanero. Garlic Parmesan was by far my favorite. Crispy and good size wings. Definitely going back.

I had a bad experience at first with the workers attitudes, but I didn't post. I did end up liking the food and the second experience was better. I will go back and the fried pickles are yummy but very very salty.

Ordered online. I ordered sweet heat and half hot with fries. My order was ready in less than 10 minutes the staff there was really great, really friendly, they greeted me as soon as I walked in, not to mention  the wings were excellent,  not bad for my first time there.  It's a nice little spot and I will patronize again!!

This is the second time I've been here. The food is ok, but the service is horrible. Both times I've ordered potato salad and they take my order only to come out and tell me they don't have any. The service is the worst I've had in years. I mentioned to the cashier this is the second time this has happened and got attitude. Don't think the wings are good enough to deal with the poor service

Wings are nothing special. I haven't tried any other flavor brides the hot.  The wings seemed like u could have gone to costco, got frozen wings, fried them, poured franks hot sauce on them, and there you go.   They were slimy and just plain average. There's much better around town.  The employees were very nice and courteous though.

Just recently found this place, and we've been coming back for the past few weeks without hesitation. The chicken wings here are great! They're not dry like most places. Employees always treat us kindly and always get our orders correct. I recommended the lemon pepper flavor and mild with a side of hot sauce! Fried pickles here are delicious! I really recommend you try this place out. Drive thru is also very quick, faster than most McDonald's! Crazy right?! Haha
Kids loved it!  We had mild, teriyaki, and naked boneless.  All were good :). We will definitely be back soon!
The wings and service here are great !! Well worth the money ! Ya'll made a pregnant woman satisfied! We will definitely be back .

I tried the garlic Parmesan and the mild wings with fried pickles. They were very delicious, I can't wait to come back and try other flavors. Keep in mind thought it looks kinda ghetto but the wings are well worth it! They have a variety of flavors to choose from, and they throw in a couple sticks of celery. I'm not a big celery fan but I'm sure other people would appreciate it more than me. It's a great place to try at least once, especially if you're a wing connoisseur such as myself! Also the girl that worked there was cute so I'm definitely coming back ;)
The sweet heat wings are the best but all around each flavor is great! Service can be slow if going through the drive-thru but they are always made fresh and are well worth the wait!

It was my first time trying it out and I loved it! The garlic parmigian wings are a must get and the fried pickles are by far the most crunchy, and best tasting fried pickles ever. The staff is very friendly and is very helpful for first time costumers. I will be going back again soon.

Only getting 4 stars cause I've only been once. However, these wings are great!! I've been in Vegas 2 years and am still trying to find a decent wing place because I am just not a fan of buffalo wild wings. 

I got the 12 peice with half  hot and half BBQ. I love basic hot wings and they did a great job on those. My bf loves more mild or bbq. We inhaled these as soon as we got home. The wings were a decent size and we're still piping hot by the time I got home (about 15 mins). I would definitely come here over BWW. 
This place is not far from home.and will definitely be a new favorite spot for us! Also love that they have a drive through!! I think I may be waited 5 mins total.

This place was awesome !!! I had the bomb wings and they  The absolute best hot hot hot wings I have had since moving to Las Vegas! the restaurant was clean the staff was great!! I will definitely be back

I was sitting on my couch craving some good wings like I do everyday and was tired of the classic go to WingStop and Buffalo Wild Wings so I googled some good places to in town and Voodoo Wings Co popped up and I thought Voodoo donuts are pretty good so this place sounds promising!! So I checked it out!! It is now my new favorite wing place! I'm a pretty big guy so I go for the 12 piece me and for my 2 flavors I picked the always delicious Garlic Parmesan and the Voodoo sauce. Now when ever you go to a new place you always have to try the house special and the cashier Tea helped convince me to try it!! And let me tell you it was by far the greatest use of Sriracha ever! I'm not the biggest fan of Sriracha and I don't understand the craze for it but the Voodoo sauce is definitely epic!! It's just above the medium sauce on their heat scale and it wasn't burning my tongue but it gave the perfect amount of spice to get the nice little tingle. I will for sure keep coming back to this place to enjoy this newly discovered flavor and bring my friends and family so they can indulge on the best wings in town!

Tried this place yesterday and ordered the fried pickles, da bomb and lemon pepper wings. First off the pickles were to salty to even eat. I tried about four thinking it was maybe one that got over salted, but no they all were disgusting and inedible. Going on to the wings the lemon pepper were also to salty I ate one. Btw I love salt, I salt everything and for me it was extreme. You can taste that they're using old oil with everything because it all tastes like the nasty fried pickles.

Fried pickles are the best thing we ordered. Chicken nuggets were okay. Sodas were HORRIBLE! We Ordered a diet and a diet Dr. Pepper.. Both were bad. Then they gave us Sprites, which were super flat. Improve the total experience for more stars.

I come here often and I love their bayou bites! Along with their fried pickles and different sauces! However their customer service is really sad. There has been two people that are really nice and friendly I usually see them in drive thru during the day. Just FYI to other customer there is a bit of a wait if you go through drive thru I honestly have no problem with it because the food is worth it. Back to the customer service... The workers seem careless and they do not know how to properly greet or even smile. I came through drive thru one day and no one even greeted me. So I waited thinking they were just busy but I gave up and walked inside. Turns out the girl that was working drive thru didn't even have her head set on and just said "I didn't even hear anything". Her head set was around her neck! I work fast food and I know how to work in a drive through I was furious when I saw that. I still was nice to her as I ordered and she just made me feel uncomfortable as if I ruined her conversation with the other workers. Btw the other workers at the time didn't seem to care either all of them just stood together In a group talking. None of them greeted also. I honestly love their food but would never come back. Which will probably make their workers happy since they don't like to work decently.  There has been other times the workers have made me feel not welcomed here but I've brushed that off so many times because I tried to consider that they are just having a rough day or something. But like I said before there's only two good workers, good food, but mostly horrible employees.

I've tried buffalo wild wings and wing stop and they have nothing on voodoo. The sauces are so flavorful. The prices are reasonable, and everything is made to order. Fresh and hot. Love the lemon pepper and garlic parm. Will continue to return!!!!

Seriously don't know how people can eat here! 
I've been here twice and the place smells like straight raw sewage!!!!!!! 
The 1st time I thought there plumbing was backed up or something the 2nd time a few months later and the smell was still there!!!!!!! I was waiting for my food trying not to puke and a randome guy tells me "it always smells like this" ... uh grosss!
The wings are AIGHT ! Typical. nothing special. 
over priced for little wings!
Great wings! Great Price! Would love to go back drive thru was really quick! YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!

I consider myself a bit of a wing connoisseur and I found the wings to be top notch.  I ordered the mild wings and they were larger in size than most places, very moist and covered with an excellent sauce.  Cooked to perfection.  If this place can get it's service figured out, I predict a great future.
Although this place is fairly new, I go all the time! The service is fast and friendly, and the food speaks for itself! Definitely glad they replaced the tired, old KFC!!

Wings were very dry and hard again. Texture of beef jerky. I ordered the 24pc with order of fries. With sweet heat and mango, neither of the sauce was any good. I can get better wings at the frozen aisle of target.

Crispy, spicy, crunchy, tangy, juicy, sweet, garlicky, these wings will mesmerize you. Forget about waiting for BWW's 50 cent special. These Voodoo wings have a great portion of meat on them therefore the crispy outside meets the juicy moist inside. They do the flavors well, and there is something for everyone. They even offer honey mustard as a sauce. They even have a drive through so 5 stars all the way around. Service is also very quick and very decently priced. The servers know the menu and can describe the sauces, very well managed and educated.
Wings rock!!  I dig the VooDoo sauce.  Big wings and friendly staff.  My son and both love the place.

The only good thing was the hot sauce, we won't come back. The chicken looked a weird color like greenish, we figure this out on the first bite  when the chicken wing tasted dried and weird . All wings looked like that so ended up on trash . My husband got really sick since yesterday until today.

Outside is deceiving. AWESOME customer service. Food was amazing and quick.  Decently priced.
Highly recommended.

Atmosphere is okay not the best but the not worst, paint around some walls are either fading or chipped but it's has a relaxed feel. Cashier is okay could be better but it is almost 9 so she's probably tired. I got three different flavors mango habanero, Cajun ranch and garlic parmesan. I am very picky on mango habanero with that being said I would not recommend it here . Know for the Cajun ranch those wings have a flavor that just explode when you bit into it very good. Garlic parmesan was very good not the best but a must try. Fries for me had to much salt but where okay. Do not try the potato salad it was so bad my daughter almost throw up. Know I am a firm believer that ranch should be home made, I don't think they make it here the ranch tasted like a generic Kraft. Know I honestly would give a three star if it wasn't for the Cajun ranch wings.

I wanted to try this place because I'm all about supporting the locals. The staff was really nice which always makes the experience better & the food was Great. I'll for sure be back & recommend this place.

What can I say, I'm a dedicated Hooters fan, but I go to VooDoo wings more then Hooters.  I get the lemon pepper wings and the signature of VooDoo wings.  I have never been disappointed with the service of the staff or the food itself. I highly recommend go in there.

Always delicious!!! I've been coming here for about 2 years at the very least now. I recently showed My hubby and he's in love with the fried pickles! It's a must try and it's nice that the staff is super nice every time we're there as well.

We got the Bayou Bites & they were really good.. Definitely impressed by the quality of the chicken!! They don't come tossed yet but we did try their different sauces, The Sweet Heat is a sweet chili perfectly made, The Bomb which is Hot, Mango Habanero, & The Voodoo which has some gentle heat!! All the sauces were good & the ranch was also well made!!! Owner was really cool too!!! Definitely going back!!!

This is currently my favorite place to get chicken wings! Since finding this place two months ago my partner and I have become usual customers. We recommend the lemon pepper flavor and my usual is the mild with a side of hot. It can get a bit pricy when ordering for more than two. The wings are usually crispy and fresh. They are a bit oily but not too much to bother me since they are chicken wings. I've had Wing Stop wings oilier than these and not nearly as good. Out of all the times that we've gone in the past two months (around 20 times) I've only gotten old tasting wings once (reason for the 4 stars). They have a drive thru which is definitely a plus. The dining room is a bit small, but clean. I recommend this place to any wing lovers out there!

First time coming here - and what a great first impression they made. The customer service was excellent, far superior to any other "fast food" option. The food was made quickly, and it was delicious! The wings were juicy and tender, and the fried pickles were great as well! We will definitely be returning for more.
Always fresh & juicy! Plenty of meat & sauce. Great fast friendly service! Love all the flavors!!!

Drive through line was long. I have no issue with that. I do have issue with being asked for ID when paying by Visa. My card is signed and I do not have to show ID. That is a violation of your agreement with Visa.  If no one had been behind me I would have argued this fact. Please train accordingly. Also our to go boxes were jammed into one bag. The boxes also had melted in places I guess from a heat lamp.
Best wings I've ever had. I love the mild but my sister and mom rave about the lemon pepper. Also the fried pickles are a must have!

The food is excellent!!! Ima be honest.. they dont serve beer... i asked why... the cashier stated that they have minors working... she had the biggest bugger in her nose.  It was very distracting... the largest issue was the amount of flies in the dining area... because the held the back door open..  the flies were so bad that you couldn't enjoy your meal. The staff over all was not too friendly... their uniforms were dirty, bleach stained.... they actually had the nerve to police the soda machine...i wont go back... :(

Never tried them before, nice size wings, sauces can be tossed better, fries were a ripe off for that price.
In the future may try again.

First timer from California, ordered parmesan garlic, lemon pepper and, voo doo wings.  We liked all of the flavors, but we unanimously agreed that the parmesan garlic wings were the best!  We liked the wings so much, we are going back again tonight.

Very disappointed, i loved coming here but tonight i went through the drive thru and saw 3 health code violations right in front of me! They put a dirty bucket thru the food pass and then brought a new one through placing the bucket on the counter..there was a girl eating ice with a cup then put the cup to her lips a d then proceed to get more ice with the same cup but she claimed it was another cup but i was right there watching and it wasn't....very disappointed and the owner contact me back!!! I threw out the food i did buy because if they are going to do that in front of me what do they do when you are not looking...
Gross. If you are a Wing Stop fan or Buffalo Wings this place is NOT for you. My husband brought wings and fries from this location and I was disappointed.

We are first timers.. not bad, definitely will be back for the garlic parm wings. I also love that the blue cheese is not prepackaged. The customer service was great! You guys are alright with me.  One complaint fix the taste of the fountain drinks :)

They must have changed up the recipes in the kitchen, because the low reviews from late 2014 are quickly being swept away by good reviews in 2015. Went in apprehensive but was quickly wowed by great service, and happily discovered my new favorite wing joint!

Not many sauce choices, but all the flavors I've tried have been good.
Voodoo: sriracha+soy, surprisingly good!
Garlic parm: strong garlic flavor, my new favorite.
Lemon pepper: this version is a dry rub with some oil.
Hot & Sweet: like a mango habanero elsewhere, not too spicy.

Wing are good-sized and meaty, unlike my experiences with other wing chains. Menu also has sides like fries, fried pickles, and cole slaw, but the service is top-notch! Friendly staff at the register remembered my name and order after a single visit, always super cheerful. They do have a drive-thru available.
Mediocre wings here.  My boyfriend didn't like their bbq sauce at all and felt the packages were weird.  We will probably stick with wing stop.

I was really excited to try this place after reading the reviews and it's fairly close to home. Upon entering the cashier was very friendly and helpful since we had never been before. We decided to dine in, and the young lady said she would bring our food as soon as it was ready. Once she brought our food I realized she had forgot our ranch no big deal except she only gave me one and I ask for another since we had two meals. She explained that would cost extra, so I ask then why would you ask if I wanted ranch when I ordered. She ended up giving it to me at no extra cost. I was just a little annoyed by that. The wings were nice and hot and had plenty of meat. And I was pleasantly surprised that the boneless wings were so tasty!! Normally I stay away from boneless because they are breaded so much and there's no meat; but not here!! I was a little disappointed to find the French fries were hot since the wings seemed to be so fresh. And next time if your not going to clean your celery at least cut off the dirty parts before serving to costumers. Thank god I didn't see the dirt until I was basically done eating or that would have ruined my appetite, seeing how they were on the side of my wings. Over all decent place I will be back to try again.
Hazel was awesome. Really took care of me when my order was wrong. Love this place. Best wings ever
AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING. Great employees, and great food. Best wings in Vegas. The girl even remembered what I got last time. Such a great place. I love everything about it.

We were pleased to see a wing joint open up in the near vicinity of our home. This used to be the home of Guthrie's Chicken and although my husband was a fan, I was not sad to see it go. After reading some reviews I decided to give this place a shot. I do like the fact that you can place your order ahead of time through the eat24 website, in addition to having a drive thru if you're feeling extra lazy or are on the go. My complaint about their menu on the eat24 website is that there is no description of the wing sauce flavors. So I can choose the "voodoo" flavor, but what is it? In any case, we opted for six voodoo wings, six hot and sweet, and an order of garlic parmesan bayou bites (boneless). The voodoo is suppose to be a mix of sriracha and soy sauce, but it did not have too much flavor. Hot and sweet was kind of like mango habanero at BWW with much less heat. The bayou bites flavor was good but they were super greasy.

I think the price point is right for the mass produced on the go wings -- it is $4.99 for six wings. The sides they offer are pretty limited and to the point consisting of fries, fried pickles, and cole slaw. I would rate this joint well below Buffalo Wild Wings in flavor and quality, but are a decent option if you are on the go and are craving some wings.

I have been coming here for YEARS. Where else can you get fresh chicken wings from a drive thru? I personally love their mango habanero flavor, and my husband loves the mild one. When I first started coming here back in 2013/2014, their fries were perfect! Then they changed it later to this frozen crinkle looking fry that seriously sucked, and now I've noticed they have changed it again to a more homemade, shaved right off the potato and fried kind of fry (see picture). The current fries are an improvement, but not as good as their original fries. I'm not sure why they keep changing them. I love their wings so much that I just make an extra stop and combine them with McDonald's fries. Sometimes the wait can be ridiculously long, but the wings are fire.

First of all, I LOVE that this place has a drive through! This place is pretty close to my house so I have driven through a couple of times. Tonight, I got the Bayou Bites (mild) with fries and a side of fried pickles. The food is good, but not amazing. It satisfies my wing and fried pickle craving :) 

The fries were not very good tonight and the drive thru service was not the best. I had to wait for a very long time to get my food and there was nobody in front of me! I would recommend the fried pickles for sure! The Bayou Bites were pretty good too. Will be coming back since it's so convenient!
Food was excellent. Wings are the best in town. The voodoo flavor was my favorite I recommend that to anyone who loves let of flavor

I love wings, so I stop in to check out the place. First thing I notice is all the grime from peoples hands on the door, and that nasty floor.. I have a soy allergy so I ask the cashier what kind of oil they use. Oh boy, I got the deer in the headlight look. Luckily a different employee overheard and went to look. She said it had oil in it, and told me the brand name. Really?? We left, I will never go in that place again. It smelled like rancid oil, the place was filthy and I'm pretty sure the cook wasn't supposed to be dressed the way he was....

Oh my gosh! Just moved into the area and have been wanthing to try them. I'm so glad I did! The wings were crispy and not overly sauced. The sauces were perfectly sweet and spicy. The price is completely reasonable for amazing wings. I will definitely be going back!

The flavor is unbelievable. This place is a far drive from the strip, but definitely worth it. I tried some of their desserts as well. The banana pudding , and the brownie bites were also extremely tasty. Love it here.

Awh man where do I even begin.. the first time I had this, everything was on point! I was truly amazed. Living around this location Buffalo Wild Wings is a bit far from me so I was trying to find something in the neighborhood and I found this gem. The next two times after that I felt like the food was kind of slacking. The wings felt like they were over done and I was starting to lose faith. After a few weeks I went back and it felt like the first time all over again. I honestly feel like I come here every week which is kind of bad because ya know fast food and all but this place is irresistible! I always get the garlic Parmesan wings and this are the best garlic Parmesan wings I have tasted. If you're ever in the are definitely stop in and check this place out!

Wings are good but the staff is really slow mentally and physically. I appreciate the freshness, I understand the wait on those but the fact that I had to wait 7 minutes while my food was sitting at the drive through was ridiculous... They where dealing with another customer and it took three of them, that long?  Needs more sufficient staff.

Highly do not recommend going to eat here. 
Ordered online and went to go pick up my order
(First )The restaurant didn't have any ice in their ice machine for your drinks. (Second) drove all the way home to realize that my order wasn't right. (Third) tried to call the store 7 times before I could get an employee to answer to tell them that my order was messed up and I was heading back to the restaurant for them to fix it . (Last) the food messed up my husbands stomach !

I hve meant to review this place long ago.I was fairly new to Vegas and was looking for a wing spot other than WING STOP.Then our crew from work all came here for lunch and every since I have been hooked.I even got the family hooked.

Maybe it's because Vegas is flooded with subpar chains like B-dubs & Wing Stop, but if you ask me, it's hard to find consistently good wings in this city. So, when I saw VooDoo Wings opening only about 10 minutes away, it hit the top of the bookmark list pretty quick. We've now been here a couple times and I've got mixed feelings...

First of all, this location is hit and miss. If you've been in the area before, you've probably seen this particular spot go through a few business changes. The most recent was Guthrie's, who didn't last long at all. Aside from what looks like a fresh coat of paint and some new wall décor, the place hasn't changed much. It's nice to see they kept the drive thru though, since there's definitely very few places with wings who have one. My biggest gripe is much like businesses before it, VooDoo seems to be having issues keeping the place clean. On both our visits, we walked into a nearly empty restaurant with several tables visibly dirty. And considering the amount of staff behind the counter each time, I don't quite get how that happens.

As far as the menu goes, it's obviously just mainly wings and sides. The wings are offered as what I guess you can call personal size, with orders of 6, 9, or 12. Then they also have large orders in 24, 48, 75 and 100. There's also about 10 sauces to choose from and a handful or so of sides available. The pricing is pretty dang reasonable, and for just over $2, you can even make the smaller wing orders a combo that includes both a side and drink. I also like that VooDoo includes both celery, carrots and a dipping sauce in the advertised price. 

So, now that I've been here a couple times, I've been able to try a couple different sauces. While most of them are pretty standard, they do offer a couple sort of unique flavors. The first is their "Voodoo" sauce, which they describe as a mix of Sriracha and soy sauce. I ended up ordering this flavor on both my visits, and sadly it tasted different each time. The first time it was way too sweet, the second it was mostly just heat, and even though I love Sriracha, it just wasn't the right flavor. They also have a "Sweet Heat" flavor which is a bit similar to BWW's Asian Zing, and as it's name suggests, is a good balance of both sweet and spicy flavors. But the biggest problem I've had with VooDoo, and all their sauces, is they just put way too much on them. Every time I finish eating, there's still a pool of sauce sitting at the bottom of the boat. The flavors are good, and I like the sauces, but just not enough to where I want to feel like I'm drinking it when I eat the wings.

I've also noticed on both our visits that a few of the wings seem to get undercooked. Each time, there was at least 1 or 2 wings in the orders that were at the stage where it's probably safely edible, but just not tasty edible. The meat was still kind of gooey and limp. I ended up having to throw them away because they were just too hard to eat. Aside from those though, the rest of the wings were very decent. I'll just be ordering mine well done from now on. And for a fast food style joint, the sides are pretty solid. I have no complaints for any of the things we tried (fried pickles, french fries & coleslaw).

Overall, VooDoo is definitely a welcome addition to what's available in town. The food is decent, it's priced right and it's always nice to have another choice for wings. I'll definitely be returning at some point, but they aren't doing anything well enough to stop my search for consistently good wings in Vegas.

I can't stop thinking of the Parmesan chicken...! You can place an order online through Eat 24. Just make sure you do it when they are open. The order will still go through and you won't know until you go there to pick it up that they are closed.

Overall, the taste and size of the kegs and wings you get are filling and beefy...!
Food was good, wing sauces are ok. Want to change it up this place is an alternative.

We love voodoo wings! My husband and I order from here at least once a week. I work about 10 minutes away so as soon as I get off of work, I call and place a pick up order and they are almost always ready for me to pick up. 

The flavors that we love are the lemon pepper, they are seasoned very well, as well as the very hot flavor, bomb. Apparently their bomb flavor was featured on a food network show called Heat Seekers, and if you love hot, this flavor is incredibly hot! We love it though. In addition, the wings are always cooked correctly, crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Their pickle chips are also very good. 

Give this wing place a try!

I'm kind of a wing snob, so I was leary trying some place I'd never heard of, but am I glad I did.  I was disappointed to see that Guthrie's had gone out of business since I think they were much better than Cane's.  This was really just a trial run I was giving Voodoo so I just went basic with 9 mild wings.  They were great. Much better than I had ever expected.  They were very meaty and the sauce was excellent.   I hate all these places that have anorexic looking wings, this place does not have that problem.  I will definitely be back to try some different flavors and sides.  The fact that this place has a drive trough just makes it that much better.  A drive thru wing place ROCKS!  They need a website though.

Stopped by VooDoo Wings after some holiday shopping, also known as buying myself a new phone. The wings were, but not amazing. They don't do half flavors on the 6 pack of wings, but they will if you get 9 or more. I also got the fried pickles as a side. I decided on Voodoo, which is kind of sweet with sriracha sauce, and Mango Habanero, which is supposed to be hot. Both were actually sweet, and not very hot at all, so don't be afraid to try the hotter sounding flavors. The fried pickles were, not as good as I've had back home, but better than anything else here. 

The store was clean, and the girl behind the counter was sweet. She even brought the food out to me. They also have a drive-thru, which is nice. 

Overall, I wasn't terribly impressed with the place, but they're ok for fast food wings.

Ok, so we had a little issue with ordering on the site and having wings delivered. 
We ordered wings for the VGK game and bc we had children eating the wings we ordered them with sauces on the side and when it was delivered all the wings had bbq sauce all over everything. And other sauces on the side... 70$ down the drain bc no one ate them. And we ended up going and ordering other food. My husband who likes bbq sauce didn't even enjoy them bc they had so much sauce. Oh well, we filed a complaint with the service we ordered from and we received nothing from them or the company. Live and learn!

I've been coming here for a while now so obviously the wings are decent but lately the service is horrible TWICE I've dined in RECENTLY and have had to here sexual encounters and curse words from the EMPLOYEES which I think is super unprofessional and disrespectful. They are all female and very trashy if you have children or want a professional dine experience this is NOT the place to go

This place definitely has potential. This was my first visit and wasn't stellar, but I will return and give it another shot. I went through the drive-thru, which turned out to be a good thing. Apparently the air conditioning was out and it was a little warm inside. There were no cars in front of me, but it seemed to take awhile to get my grub.

I got an eight piece "bite" combo. "Bite" is Vodoo's boneless wing. I ordered "hot" as my flavor of choice and got bleu cheese for my dipping sauce. The combo comes with eight "bites", choice of side and a beverage. I opted for cole slaw instead of fries. The slaw didn't compare to grandma's, but then again, nothing does. It was decent and the portion size was sufficient.  The chicken was breaded and smothered in hot wing sauce.  It was tender with good flavor. The combo meal was just a tad over eight bucks.

All in all, it was A-Ok. I will definitely give it another go and see if a four star upgrade is in order.

Am I crazy to say that the fried pickles from here are more desirable than the wings? Don't get me wrong - I enjoyed the wings here, but the fried pickles was a damn homerun. It clearly was the batter used. They were light, had a slight crisp and not overly oily. I always have to go with a hot and a not hot choice for my wing flavors for the balance. The lemon pepper was good and the traditional hot was good, but seemed a tad bit spicy than what I imagined what hot was. Voodoo is still a top choice when it comes to chicken wings for me.

We love their wings!! I usually get the bite meal, 8 piece boneless wings with your choice of side a dipping sauce and a drink. Their fries are seasoned just right and crinkled. My husband gets the regular wings and makes it a combo. His favorite wing flavor is their Voodoo house choice. We have tried banana pudding and thought it was delish. 
Their dipping sauce is the small cups wish they were bigger. We always order extra ones. 
Their service is okay. We only use the drive thru! So easy. They do take some time to prep the food but its fresh and made to order. We truly don't mind waiting because we know it is so tasty and its fresh.

So I finally tried this Wing Spot and it was pretty yummy I got the garlic parmesan chicken wings and the mango habanero and they were tasty topped it off with an  order of fried pickles I will definitely be going back to the spot

This review  is going to be  short  because it's a wing spot. So all they serve are wings. The prices were reasonable. The wings are very delicious they're big wings not the cheesy little pizza place wings. The customer service was friendly and attentive. they have great flavors to put on them. I got mine plane with my flavor on the side. I had the lemon pepper butter, medium hot, and sweet Heat and it comes with blue cheese or Ranch. I really like their fries they were kind of Twisted fat wedges very unique and very Hardy for a french fry I really like this place and I will definitely be coming here for more wings. It was better than Wingstop and Buffalo Wild Wings

24 pieces chicken fed two adults and 3 kids 8-10. The barbecue sauce and the voodoo sauce were great! Would probably ask for chicken to be cooked a little crispier next time. We were not crazy about the fried pickles but it was worth venturing out and trying something different.  The soft drink machine was broken which was disappointing so I asked for 5 cups of water, I was disappointed to be charge $.25 per cup.  Bottom line:  I might go back in if in the area and in a wing mood.

5 stars. I was in the neighborhood getting gas nearby and it was lunchtime. The reviews seemed mixed so I wanted to see for myself. I went through the drive through and the girl easily answered my questions about the difference in sauces. Originally I was deciding  between The Bomb and Voodoo. She explained that they both had soy sauce but The Bomb had things like Ghost Pepper and etc. so I figured I'd save that flavor for the boyfriend. I decided to go with Mango Habanero and it was excellent. She was extremely helpful and very friendly. I really appreciate when the person at the drive through shows good customer service. 
I ordered the bayou bites and they were great. Each bite is all chicken tossed in your preferred sauce. She said I could split the order with two sauces for an additional charge. 

This place isn't near me but when I'm over on this side of town I'll definitely be back. Good job Voodoo!

All I can say is if you are a wing lover you have to try Voodoo Wing Company! I have seen this building go from KFC to Guthries and now VooDoo and had been hesitant to try them until reading the Yelp reviews. We went for the first time tonight for my mom's 95 th birthday..yes she wanted wings. Good prices, great customer ServxieService and the wings are unbelievable. Fresh and hot, good portion not the wings had so much meat on them. Fries were fresh and hot. Sauces were delicious too, we had the garlic parmesan, sweet heat and teriyaki but they also tasted fabulous plain. We will,definitely return soon!

Came here yesterday (03-20-15) with my boyfriend to try this place out. We ordered 6 piece sweet heat chicken wings, 6 piece hot chicken wings, macaroni salad, french fries, fried pickles and 2 sweet teas since I always hear and read about people stating how amazing the teas are.

The sweet heat sauce was really sweet. No heat to it at all. I liked it but wish there was a little heat to it. The hot sauce was actually what it is hot. I liked it. The French fries were great. Crispy outside and soft on the inside. I fried pickles were great too. Only if they had a dipping sauce for it :(. The macaroni salad was a little bit in the salty side. The sweet teas... WAY TO SWEET! I swear I thought they put a whole bag of sugar in itt. I watered mine down and it was still to sweet that I had to have them put some unsweetened tea in it which the lady at the counter was super nice and didn't mind doing that for me.

The staff were all super nice. Very pleasant and they all greet you as soon as you walk in. It was also clean on the inside as well. I can't wait to try this place out again!
Great sauces!!  Garlic Parmesan delicious and bomb was pretty hot!!  The wings were crispy and hot. Great service as well!

This place is very very tasty. The drive thru is still there so you can enjoy that, it was fast and the person who took my order was very peppy and helpful which was awesome!

The wings were perfectly cooked and very large. The only draw-back is the sides. We got french-fries and potato salad. The fries were great (according to my girlfriend) the potato salad although good the portion was incredibly small. It came in a 2 oz little plastic cup and was definitely not what I expected for $1.89 worth of potato salad which is why only 4 stars.

Other than that this place is a smash hit, avoid the sides get the wings you can mix and match the flavors as well and you won't be disappointed at all.

Watch out other wing places this is a serious contender in my opinion!

Wings for days. First time trying this wing spot. Craving the good old deep fried chicken wings. 

Decent selection of flavors to chose from on the menu. Voodoo probably their social sauce since it's on their name. It taste like a Siracusa and soy sauce, but I'm not too sure. I order 8 piece voodoo, 8 BBQ and 8 garlic parmesan. Totaling 24 wings and a bread pudding. 

What's great about this place is the fact that their wings are not the tiny ones you usually get when ordering wings. It's pretty massive. Plentiful tables to chose from, huge tv screen to watch tv and the service was 10/10. The wings were served super quick and the ladies taking my order were so nice. 

This place got spunk, in a good way. These wings, mind blowing. Sooooooo delicious. Out of the three wings I ordered the garlic parmesan was my favorite. Crispy and hot. 

Definitely returning for more wings, ordering another 24! For my wing lovers and finger food people, go try this establishment already. Voodoo is super wicked.
Yummy wings. Tasted exactly like wing stop to me (lemon pepper). Just wished their fries were the same. Besides that will come here again!

The wings were cooked perfect. Crispy but plenty of sauce for flavor. The fries were hot and fresh and even the ranch dressing was yummy!  The staff was nice and courteous. The dining room clean and well kept. Will definitely come back!

I heard about this place from a coworker so I thought I would try it out. I had the 9 piece wings with half mild and the other half teriyaki. Overall the wings are good but to be honest the taste was similar to what I could make at home with my personal deep fryer. The fries are not good at all and I would not choose them as a side again if I were to come eat here a second time. I rated this place 2 stars because there was nothing special about there wings, the fries are not tasty at all and the facility itself needs a little work!

This is somewhat close to my house and I didn't notice it. My bf told me to stop by after work and get a take out. I called in and made an order. When I got there, it's nice to see they have a drive thru since there's definitely very few places with wings who have one.

The choices are just mainly wings and sides. 
Flavor choices are hard to choose from since they all sound great. I ordered 12 pieces of Mild and 12 pieces of Lemon Pepper.

Each wing was cooked to perfection and coated perfectly. I like the Lemon Pepper, they were flavorful and juicy.

If you haven't tried Voodoo Wings, you need to! Go Now! Get some wings!

Fisrt time here, my 16 year old decided it will be a good idea to try THE BOMB WINGS... definitely not one of his best ideas. The experience and service was amazing and one too remember. Food was great and made fresh with AWESOME flavors.  We will be coming back for more. If you haven't tried it. I highly  recommend you give it a shot you will not regret.

Have been coming here for over a year, recently went and ate inside. Food is amazing, somethings are a little odd. If you get 75 wings you only get to pick 3 flavored but if you order smaller amount you get more choices.
    Part of order was messed up, didn't complain let the staff know and they didn't offer to fix it BUT again food is good. Self serve drinks been down for awhile so have to ask for them.
 I hope the manager or owner reads the reviews and fixes it because we want to come back and if things remain the same and service is lacking don't know how that will work. 
 Cashier was friendly was a young man and the lady cooking was nice the lady who didn't offer to help with messed up order was maybe a supervisor? Not to sure.
Good wings.  Fast service.  Good crew.  Evertime I come here I am on a time crunch and they get me in and out on time and they remember my name...  nice job!!!!

Fast casual restaurant w/ drive thru.

Excellent service, staff was friendly and inviting. Patiently waited as I looked over menu.  Quickly realized I was a first time customer and offered samples of flavors.

I had the 12 piece wings(voodoo/mango habanero) combo with fried pickles.  The voodoo good, but I really liked the mango habanero.  The pickles were really good but looked like the bottom dwellers were a little on the greasy side. Other than that I enjoyed the meal.

If you want quality wings in Las Vegas, this is THE place to go, I have had no better wings in the Las Vegas area. 

The customer service was great, the price was good, and the quality of the food was amazing. 

We tried two sauces the garlic and the voodoo, neither were that spicy at all the voodoo is right below the hot on their scale but I didn't find it hot at all, the next time that I go back I am going to get the one right above the hot. 

The fried pickles were spot on, the breading was nice and light, the flavor was excellent. 

Cheers!

Found this place on Google, they had decent reviews. When I got here I was a little surprised to see that it is actually a shack. The bathroom smell terrible along with this service.  I asked to sample the wing flavors before I ordered and I was told you can only sample three. I ended up only trying the hot and mango habanero which were not bad, but decent. I oredered 9 wings and a side of fries the price came out to about $12 and some change. Good price I would say. I ordered my wings extra crispy; all flats. The wings are not very saucey when you get the actually dry. I don't like my wings tasting fatty, but they did. I had to pay an additional $.81 for a side of sauce because my wings are dry. The fries, hmmm I would pass the taste like the fries you can cook at home. Overall, I will not recommend this place I would say stick to Wingstop!

Great wing company!  The drive through is a nice option.  When we went for the first time a few weeks ago, they gave us free samples.

They don't "oversauce" the wings either.

Love it!  Prices are good, too!

Yum! So happy with my experience here! The gentleman behind the counter was very informative and thoughtful. I watched the cooks a bit as I'm a chef and am just nosey that way. I saw them reading the tickets carefully, thoughtfully saucing and tossing the wings, wearing gloves, looking like they enjoy their job. I like to see that, happy people make good tasting food. The fried pickles here and plentiful and AMAZINGLY crunchy. The Bomb flavor was really spicy which I like. the mango habanero didn't taste like mango or habanero to me, but it was still really tasty. Sidewinder fries were awesome and I believe they make their own ranch which is always a plus.
Excellent variety of sauces. Only complaint is the staff is semi-competent, and sometimes the dining area is not very clean.
Great wings, awesome flavor choices, the boneless wings are also great. Good prices, friendly staff. Will be our wing place of choice from now on

For this place being a drive-thru wing place.. The wings here are nothing short of amazing!!! By far the best wings in town, I'm always so disappointed going to other places and having mediocre wings. The wings here are always so flavorful, juicy but yet still crispy..  And best part is that if you are looking for something fast and still delicious this is the place!

I've tried a couple of the flavors but my favorite are lemon pepper and sweet heat, by far.

Staff is always friendly and efficient. 

Fried pickles are a definite MUST. You cannot leave without getting some!!!!!

Been coming since it opened and only recently tried the boneless wings. I've tried all the flavors and enjoy each and every one. Lemon pepper and sweet heat might be my fav. Garlic Parmesan could use more garlic and Parmesan. The sweet tea is bomb so I get it all the time.  My only recommendation is to remove the old KFC buckets off the entry doors since it's Voodoo now.

Made fresh! I ordered the mild bites with ..... yes fried pickles! Yummy I had to try them and they were delicious!! Staff was very friendly, food was great! 5 stars all the way! Very clean place! Will be back! Thanks Voodoo!!

Nothing bad I can say about this wing place. The service was really good when me and my friend first walked in. The menu was simple to read and order from. I like the variety of sauces they had. My favorite would be the garlic Parmesan. Far better than any other wing place by far. My friend I order to eat there and once we finished, we ended up ordering more to eat lol. I'm surprised because the building was an old KFC, which they are still using the drive-thru and they were still cranking out wings. I love their wings and service. This is a must go!

This is my first review I've written. Just moved to Vegas & trying new places to eat. I have to say these wings are so good. They have it mild, hot,  & sweet. I've tried the bbq & mild and loved both of them. It's a bit messy but they give you wipes and lots of napkins. ..this place has quickly become one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.
One of the best wings spots in Las Vegas! if you live in the Northwest check out Voodoo Wings!

Solid 3 1/2 Stars!

Can't believe this place was a former KFC...imagine the irony, now it's a wing joint!  Voodoo Wings does some decent grub!

I do have another preferred chain for chicken wings, but Voodoo will do in a pinch.  They have some standard wing flavors along with some new concoctions.  We tried a 12 piece wing set to go in the following flavors:

-Hot
-Garlic Parmesan

Verdict?  Wings are just OK.  They were not bad at all but they seemed a tad smaller in size compared to other wing places around town.  Voodoo's hot wings were average, they weren't very hot at all & they were a bit drowned out in flavor.  Still pretty good with blue cheese for dipping though!  The Garlic Parmesan flavor wings were just OK as well.  I wanted them to have more cheese flavor, these were heavier on the salt.

Standout though were the Fried Pickles!  These were tasty!  They were battered just right, crispy but not too thick.  Batter was flavorful too, salty, zesty, spicy all in one bite!  I would go to Voodoo Wings again just to order these.

Prices were on par with other wing places here in LV, it cost us under $20 for 12 wings, celery, side of Fried Pickles, and a large drink.  On a good note, all that food managed to feed a family of 3 just right!  

Likin' the voodoo that you doo!
Tried for the first time last night.  Ordered to go wings.  The employees were friends and our food was great.  I will be back.

Bookmarked for awhile and wanting a taste for wings I decided to give them a try. Walking in the place looks a little run down, but I don't mind hole in the wall type spots. I ordered 9 wings voodoo & lemon pepper, w/fried pickles. After about 10mins the order was ready. 

The fried pickles were good. I'd say a 3.5 because they didn't seem freshly dropped. The lemon pepper wings were a 5. Voodoo wings 4 because they didn't seem as fresh as the lemon pepper. Service was also ok, nothing spectacular I'd say a 3. The Voodoo wings are really tasty in flavor. 

I went back the next day ordered 12 & 6 wings added the bomb wings to my order. Those wings are hot as HELLLLLLLLL. Pretty good wing spot.

Friend recommended me to try voodoo wings, they were really nice when I ordered, I didn't know what to order, so they explained to my mom and I. Once we order the food came out in about 10 minutes, the young lady brought it out, and the food looked delicious, flavor was definitely bomb.com my mom and I left really happy. Not only they serve yummy food they have good customer service
Good wings. Went while they were busy (1 hour before closing) so seemed a tad chaotic. Order was fresh and accurate.

Actually excited about writing this review. Was looking for a new wing place and decided to give Voodoo a try and I'm glad we did. Wings were perfect. Cooked perfect, sauce was perfect, blue cheese and ranch, yes you guessed it, PERFECT. More I think about it, the ice in the soda was perfect. Fried pickles are awesome, if you're a fan of fried pickles you have to give em a try. I have to admit it there is nothing bad I can say about this visit, everything was great. We will definitely be eating here again. Voodoo Wings, thanks for the great dinner totally made our day. 
Traditional hot is excellent with blue cheese. Best wings I've had in a really long time.

I live not to far from here so I stopped in to give it a try & I am soooo glad that I did! This place is everything! Their wings are hot and fresh every single time ... Not only that, but  they are HUGE! waaaayyyy more meat then BWW or Wing Stop and they are much faster than them as well .... not to mention better priced as well!

I waited no more than 10 minutes for an order of 9 lemon pepper wings, 9 mango habanero wings, 12 hot wings and a bites combo . They also come with celery and sauce, which is a nice difference from the other wing places as well . My husband is super picky about his lemon pepper chicken, but he absolutely loves theirs! 
We will continue to be frequent customers!!

I was hesitant to try this place at first because of the luke warm reviews. I'm so glad I decided to step out of my comfort zone and give Voodoo a try. I ordered the Garlic Parms. and Lemon Pepper wings. Both were sooooo good!! Lots of great flavor and fried to perfection. I was very satisfied. The prices are very reasonable too.  24 wings for $20.

I've driven past this place many times and I decided to had to try it. Honestly, I'm a Wingstop fan. I can eat their lemon pepper wings everyday, so I decided to try lemon pepper at Voodoo. They were ok. I also tried the Sweet Heat. YES PLEASE! My girls and I enjoyed both flavors today with fries and fried pickles. I ordered a 12 piece lemon pepper meal, 6 piece sweet heat and fried pickles. I paid $23 and change. This was definitely worth the drive for a wing place with a drive-thru.

So I have become a regular at this place as I am in here close to weekly. The restaurant is clean and staff greets you as you walk in the door. The wings, in my opinion, are the best in Las Vegas; they are hot & crispy and there is no coating of any kind other than your choice of flavor. My favorite is the garlic parmesan.

Drive thru chicken wings? And FRIED? YES!

I was craving some delicious wings Easter Sunday, unfortunately they were closed. We came on Monday after work and went through the drive thru due to the crazy weather and my laziness. They have a decent menu, which includes the typical wings, fries, and fried pickles; as well as buffalo bites and other offerings.

We got the 12 piece in mild 10.99ish, an order of fries, and an order of fried pickles. The wings were delicious! I love that they're fried and not just blah and baked. The fries were just ok, for 1.89 the serving is actually small and they're a little limpy, and the fried pickles were missing seasoning or something, for 2.39 they're not bad (I'm a big fan of BWW fried pickles! but these are not the same) I wish they would make a separate dipping sauce, like a spicy ranch for the FP. 

We spent about $17 for the meal, which was pretty ok. The customer service is cool for a drive thru, they were very nice. We liked the wings, so we would probably go back for them.

Yay!
Overall the wings are good. Flavorful, I got my favorite flavors Lemon Pepper and Garlic parmesan. The ranch? Way too watery. The fried pickles were pretty good.

I wasn't all impressed with this establishment. I paid $12 for an 8 wing combo. My side of veggies were just plain celery sticks. The wings were odd and strangely shaped. You can get better quality wings at the wing bar at Albertsons. Don't waste your money.

Had them for the first time yesterday and I have to say I am in love. Better than bww by a long shot. I order 6 hot wings, 6 garlic Parmesan wings and fried pickles. All for $13 and change. And the pickles oh my gosh. Amazing! Stayed crispy and crunchy so perfect. And the garlic pArm were the best. Oh and they gave me a small sweet tea on the house! Needless to say I will be returning. Many times

Okay I will just say this !!! Omg the fried pickles are amazing the wings have fantastic flavor!!! I had the lemon pepper that was bomb also The bomb that was good but waaaayyyyyyu to HOT for me  the only complaint I have is that it is so far from me lol
This place was pretty good. The fried pickles were on point and wings well cooked. I need to go back and try some more flavors.

Wings are ok, fries - no seasoning, fried pickles are pretty good... Need I say more?
This place is a short drive away from my house so when I forget how unimpressive Voodoo wings are, I order out. I've tried mild, lemon pepper, garlic parmesan, and teriyaki. I find the wings to be a little dry and the garlic parmesan super oily. The consistency of the dipping sauces is a little weird to be as well, the honey mustard smelled like mayo and was super thick. Blue cheese was hella thick as well. 
I wish fries was better, last time we got food from here, I was craving fries and my sweetie wanted wings but only one of us ended up satisfied. The fries had NO seasoning at all. I had to season it myself. Rude! I did like the fried pickles though, yum!

*This is my updated review. 
I came here Feb 2015 when they first opened and I gave them 3 stars because service was very slow and the wings were just ok. I came for the 2nd time march 2016 and it was much better. I ordered the hot wings (asked for well done) and the sauce was great and cooked crispy like requested. Only reason I have for 4 stars and not 5 was the conduct of the employees working at the time, a lot of horse play and loud personal talk, and that was everything I witnessed from the drive thru.

Pretty good. The wings are extra crispy and the fried pickles are yummy. My only complaint was that everything was so salty! I never complain about salt because I love it but this was the first time I really thought something was too salty.

Tried this place out, since it is right by my job. I was craving bar food, and this place did not disappoint! I got plain wings with ranch. The wings had a good flavor to them, even though they were plain. The ranch and fries were super tasty! My only issue was the brownie bites. Ours were a little burnt on the outside and not soft on the inside. Besides that though, this place is totally being added to our weekly rotation of lunch foods.

opted for the 18 wings special with fries and a side of coleslaw.
I chose half Sweet Heat and Half Garlic Parm.
The sweet heat was too sweet and drenched in sauce.  That kind of sauce is too sticky and sweet to have so much just sitting in the container.
The garlic parm was just ok...a lil too much garlic and not enough parm. 
Service was super fast and staff was friendly.  I'd go back and maybe try another flavor...or maybe just make my own like Ive been doing :)

If you love wings, then this place is great! A large variety of spices/sauces and sizes/party platters. 

The hottest flavors also have great taste, not just spice which is a HUGE plus!

They also serve a larger ratio of legs-to-wings which is great for the overall quantity of meat!!

I did not go inside the store to make my purchase. I did not have time to dine-in so, I ordered the spicy and the BBQ wings from the drive-thru window. The wings were excellent. I would definitely recommend this place if you like chicken wings.
I have tried voodoo Wings 2 times now the wings have meat on them the flavors are good but greasy have a nice day oh yeah the fried pickles are off the hook

I stopped by VooDoo tonight. I ordered my food, and when I pulled up to the window, there was a sign that read CASH ONLY. I wish that I would have known that before I ordered my food. The young employee was making an effort to get the cashier machine to get up and running. She was on the phone. This told me that a manager wasn't present. I don't expect young people to always know what to do when an emergency happens. But I am disappointed in how the situation was handled and no management was present.

I was a bit disappointed about this place. I really do not like when restaurants dont cater to their customers. They offer different combo options. For 9.99 you can get 9 wings and pick two different flavors. However if you get 24 wings for $18 dollars you can only get two flavors! Apparently you do not get additional perks for buying more wings from them. They are pretty much making you pay $20 dollars for you to get four flavors. I compare the place with buffalo wild wings which allows you to get an extra flavor every five wings. Also they charge you .25 for tap water. I understand it is not a big deal, but I also do not understand why cannot they just show customer appreciation by proving free water. We ordered the medium and sweet heat. Both flavors were good, but I personally enjoyed the sweet heat the most. The fried pickles were really good. The service was also good. Also the fact that they have a drive thru makes this location very convenient. Overall, this is an ok restaurant, but I think I will continue going to buffalo wild wings for additional flavor options.

Found two hairs in our food, two different orders, two different colored hairs. Didn't even bother to complain seeing as the place was being ran by kids who stared at us like we were some type of endangered species. Sorry can't really say how the wings tasted seeing as we obviously forgot to say hold the DNA.

Came here with my girlfriend earlier today and by God these were some of the best wings I've ever had 
I was a little skeptic about the quality of the wings due to the prices being so cheap but boy was I wrong, the food was amazing 
I'm definitely coming back
I do live this place. Sweet heat is my fav and The Bomb... I didn't give it a 5 star because the soda machine is never working, staff is great tho. Will definitely go back.

Went there last night and was blown away by the great service, the wonderful food and fantastic prices.  Ordered 24 pieces, the cashier really knew her stuff, explained the differences in the flavors and told me what the top flavors were.  I had a special request, I only like wings that are normal in size.  Not the big huge ones that most people like, you know the ones that are so big it looks like a chicken leg, but its supposed to be a wing. I am sad to say that I went to a wing stop location earlier in the day and wasted $$, the wings were hard, and had no seasoning, since I did not feel like taking the drive down to Voodoo, wont make that mistake again.  This is the top wing place to go.  Will be back again, real soon.
The Voodoo wings are no joke. They were delicious but I could only eat 2 without tearing up. Fried pickles are amazing! Will be returning to try the other flavors.

I really really REALLY wanted to give this place a 5 stars :/ but the customer service here sucks!!!!! Love the wings & wedges(fries)! Definitely recommend it ,but I do think the health department needs to come through and make sure everything is sanitized . When I went to pick my food up , nobody had any gloves on. And after reading other reviews , I really think health department could be helpful for them . Foods good though :) idk if I would want to sit down and eat there though hah

What's Buffalo Wild Wings? What's Wingstop? This place won me over! My boyfriend nd I have really enjoyed eating here since it opened up! Great prices for great food! We moved into the area a few weeks ago nd this has become out #1 spot to come to for wings!

We were getting a bit hungry and we're headed to a Thai place in the Northwest and decided to try VooDoo Wings based on some of the reviews. 

The place is a former take out fast food place repurposed and it is a bit dicey inside and outside. 

The wings are a good price, so we decided to try the 24 pack. You get up to three flavors and we went with two,  the lemon pepper and the garlic parmesan. 

You have sauces from hottest to mild which are quite a good selection.

They do have other choices that would include sides like fries or veggies. 

Service- awesome. The team there is. Very customer friendly and they are efficient and seem fun. 

Ambiance- I feel like I was in a bus stop in an old part of an old downtown somewhere. Unimaginative and kind of needing TLC. 

The Wings - they deep fry the wings and then toss them in the sauce. No dry flavors, all wet.  The wings we're way over cooked to point of shrinking and sticking to the bone. These are not your fall off the bone wings. These were underwhelming at best. In our paper trays, the amount of oil on the bottom, not sauce but oil, was about the thickness of 1/4 inch. Alot of oil.  Unappealing oil??? Too bad. 

The sauce-  found the garlic Parmesan to be awesome. Chunks of garlic mixed in creating a wonderful flavor to a tough and smallish wing.  The lemon pepper?  I could not taste it. Glad that the wings were not drenched in the sauce. 

Overall, I am going to say that I was very underwhelmed with the cooking and with the oil and the overall flavor. It was not busy when I was there at 11:30am on a Saturday. A solid 2 and 1/2 stars that I round up to three.

Awesome food. Been there a few times and never had been through the drive thru so I thought I'd give that a try and wow huge mistake. Literally sat for over 30 mins waiting in line. Not sure what the point for the drive thru is. Lesson learned go inside for way faster service!!

if we were rating the chicken wings only i would give 3 stars. but my all around experince brings it to 1 star.

main reason is customer service........

2 weeks ago was my first time here, i went thru the drive thru and after the employee gives me my food she asks me "do you want to leave a tip?
i have never in my life been asked that question, ever. very unprofessional.

i returned last night. this time, i only had $100 bill. the girl in the drive thru said thats fine she will accept it. she gave me back my change in nothing but 5 dollar bills. since i was in a rush i didnt count my change. (my fault, yes i know) when i returned to work i noticed she only gave me back $70 dollars in change. so being the fact my order was only 10 she under paid me by $20 dollars. im just not going to give her the benefit of the doubt, and im almost 100 percent positve she took it on purpose. mainly because she paid me in nothing but 5 dollar bills!! that is off by 4 bills......... be aware of this place with your money!!!!!!!!!!!!
Garlic parm bits were ok very greasy. Fries ok. But nothing special. .  Prob won't return
Not much to say best wings in vegas! Always fast and friendly service. Really good to take home. Try it! You won't be disappointed! My favorite is the sweet heat! Thai chili sauce is the best

I did not have high expectations for this place based on the one time I went there when it was Guthrie's. That place sucked bad!  But of course I got to give a new place a fair chance and try it out.  

I was greeted quickly as I entered the place and my order was taken quickly. The place was clean, and that is a good way to start a new dining experience.  The girls working the front were cute and super friendly and helpful. 

Prices are reasonable and the portions more than fair. The wings were meaty, bigger than the big chain.  And the girl waiting on me suggested the "Bayou Bites" for my daughter. The Bayou Bites are chunks of breast meat, not nuggets. I ordered them plain for my daughter and they were really really good. I got a dozen wings, half parmesan garlic and half lemon pepper.  Both were tasty but garlic parmesan was my favorite. I did not get any of the hot flavors this trip, but I did get samples of their "bomb" and "voo doo" sauces. After tasting them I wish I had ordered a hot flavor, they were both that good. 

One little detail that really makes it for me is crushed ice instead of cubes. I know, it is a small thing, but I like crushed ice. 

Another detail that really stood out when sampling the Bayou Bites is the fact you can tell it was fresh oil the chicken was cooked in. 

Overall, 5 stars!  I will be bringing buddies back here.
Wings perfectly cooked. The woman behind the counter, super cute. Sauce delish, place super clean.

This is the second time we have ate here . The first time we ordered the wings to go . Tonight we dined in . The service is amazing, very courteous employees with a southern charm addressing all customers as sir or ma'am .Now the chicken wings are amazing with awesome flavors . Defiantly will be a repeat customer .

Edible but I'm far from impressed. As first timers we were excited to try their signature Voodoo sauce which had good flavor as did their BBQ, and Garlic Parm but the real problem was the wings themselves. Gummy skin and zero taste to the meat underneath had us throwing most of our meal away. I won't be back. Plus the staff was less than helpful and seemed unclear when we asked if they offered chicken fingers they said NO never offering up the chicken bites which are pretty much what we were looking for.

Good Wings But Way To Expensive 12 wings come to $11 dollars with no sides plus there ranch cups are so small you can't even dip the wings in it Better Than Wingstop But Should Not Be Charging Buffalo Wild Wing Prices
Great deal for the wings compared to the chains around town, clean and they were extremely nice to me and my family!  I'm going to head back when I have a chance this summer.

Solid wing spot that is better than BW3!  We got the hot wings and VooDoo bites.  The wings were meaty, tender and crispy on the outside,  really good.  The Hot sauce has a good classic wing taste with some heat.  The VooDoo sauce is a ciracha & soy sauce  mix that is really good!  We will be back

Voodoo round 2.. Ordered 12 wings and two pies.. They forgot half my order and I didn't notice until I got home.. The food is tasty but service needs attention. Step it up or you'll be gone the way of Gutheries.
It was my first time trying this place ! & I can't complain wings are great it's a good price & they don't take a crazy amount of time to give you your food

Wanted a snack in the middle of my work day, gave Voodoo a shot. Girl at the counter was nice enough. I had the hot wings. Wings were good quality, but they drown them in sauce. I would prefer normal wings with hot sauce on the side. Felt like I was eating my wings out of a bowl of sauce, very messy! I didn't have any sides so can't comment, but I would give this place another go. Drive thru stayed busier than the cafe, seems like a convenient way to get your wing fix!

By far the worst service I have ever had. They have what seems to be very young girl up front who are more concerned with flirting with the guys in the kitchen instead of taking my order.
